title: Migos Apologize for iLoveMakonnen Comments: “We Love All People, Gay or Straight”
text:
2 hrs ago Migos Apologize for iLoveMakonnen Comments: “We Love All People, Gay or Straight” “We feel the world is fucked up that people have to hide and we're asked to comment on someone’s sexuality.” Quavo photo By Prince Williams/WireImage; iLoveMakonnen photo by Randy Shropshire/Getty Images 
In a new interview with Rolling Stone , Migos appeared to question the support their fellow Atlanta rapper iLoveMakonnen received when he came out publicly as gay last month. In the interview, Offset said people supported Makonnen “because the world is fucked up.” Takeoff added, “This world is not right,” and Quavo suggested that Makonnen’s homosexuality “undermines his credibility.” Migos have now apologized in the statement below. “We are all fans of Makonnen’s music and we wish he didn't feel like he ever had to hide himself,” they said. “We feel the world is fucked up that people have to hide and we're asked to comment on someone’s sexuality.” They concluded, “We love all people, gay or straight and we apologize if we offended anyone.” 
When contacted by Pitchfork, representatives for Migos offered no further comment. iLoveMakonnen’s representatives also declined to comment.
